title: PMAY or economic slowdown? Here’s what throttled India’s auto sector.
text:
The government’s housing-for-all scheme has been a hit. But is it big enough to redirect consumer spending from vehicles to housing so as to dent the business of India’s automakers? An ET Prime analysis of key data points on PMAY’s impact on automobile sales offers some interesting insights.

Because with lakhs of poor families now owning houses, their next valuable acquisition in all likelihood would be aspirational. But for that, their incomes should also improve. And that will happen only when the economy rebounds.
